translated: This is the result of stream enterer.

original: 'di ni / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of once-returner.

original: 'di ni / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the result of non-returner.

original: 'di ni / dgra bcom pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni / dgra bcom pa nyid do //
translated: This is the state of a worthy one.

original: 'di ni / rang byang chub bo //
analyzed: 'di ni / rang byang chub bo //
translated: This is a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: 'di ni / lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni / lam gyi rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: This is the knowledge of path aspects.

original: 'di ni / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: This is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes rnam par dkrug pa mdzad na /
analyzed: zhes rnam par dkrug pa mdzad na /
translated: This is the way to stir the churning stick of bodhicitta.🔽🔽

original: de'i slad du /
analyzed: de'i slad du /
translated: “Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs par ma gyur tam /
translated: Lord, has the intrinsic nature of dharmas been disturbed?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it has not.

original: ngas ji ltar na /
analyzed: ngas ji ltar na /
translated: How, Subhūti,

original: gzhan rnams khong du chud par 'gyur zhes ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams khong du chud par 'gyur zhes ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi chos nyid bstan te /
translated: “Other people will understand” is the teaching of the reality of phenomena by means of names and signs.

original: chos rnams brjod @191b de; chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs pa med do //
analyzed: chos rnams brjod @191b de; chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par dkrugs pa med do //
translated: Phenomena are expressed, but the reality of phenomena is not disturbed.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te gzhan rnams khong du chud par bgyi ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan rnams khong du chud par bgyi ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: if the Blessed One teaches the characteristics of phenomena by means of names and signs in order that others may understand,

original: chos rnams brjod pa mdzad na /
analyzed: chos rnams brjod pa mdzad na /
translated: and expresses phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad ming ma mchis shing mtshan ma mchis pa la ji ltar ming dang mtshan mas brjod pa mdzad /
analyzed: chos thams cad ming ma mchis shing mtshan ma mchis pa la ji ltar ming dang mtshan mas brjod pa mdzad /
translated: how does he express phenomena that have no names and no signs by means of names and signs?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / brjod pa ni /
translated: expression

original: ming yang ma yin /
analyzed: ming yang ma yin /
translated: is neither a name

original: mtshan ma'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma'ang ma yin /
translated: nor a sign

original: mngon par chags pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: nor attachment.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan du na sdug bsngal nyid brjod par zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan du na sdug bsngal nyid brjod par zad de /
translated: Subhūti, it is just suffering that is expressed.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They do not settle down on names and signs.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni /
translated: or the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: do not settle down on names and signs.

original: rab 'byor / gal te ming la mngon par chags par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te ming la mngon par chags par 'gyur ram /
translated: Subhūti, if they were to settle down on names or

original: mtshan ma la mngon par chags par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mngon par chags par 'gyur na ni /
translated: settle down on signs,

original: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: emptiness would settle down on emptiness,

original: mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'ang mtshan ma med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: signlessness would settle down on signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa'ang smon pa med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'ang smon pa med pa la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: wishlessness would settle down on wishlessness,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang de bzhin nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang de bzhin nyid la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: suchness would settle down on suchness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon @192a *//🔽par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon @192a *//🔽par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: the very limit of reality would settle down on the very limit of reality,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang chos kyi dbyings la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang chos kyi dbyings la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: the dharma-constituent would be attached to the dharma-constituent,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas la mngon par chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'dus ma byas la mngon par chags par 'gyur te /
translated: and the uncompounded would be attached to the uncompounded.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang ming tsam du zad pas na /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang ming tsam du zad pas na /
translated: All these dharmas are just names.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They

original: ming tsam la gnas pa med do //
analyzed: ming tsam la gnas pa med do //
translated: are not established in just names.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming dang mtshan ma tsam la gnas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ming dang mtshan ma tsam la gnas te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom by standing in just names and signs,

original: de la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: but should not be attached to them.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: gal te de ltar 'dus byas 'di dag thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dus byas 'di dag thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du bas pa lags na /
translated: if all these compounded things are just names and signs,🔽for whose sake do bodhisattva great beings arouse the mind of awakening

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gang gi don du byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gang gi don du byang chub tu sems bskyed cing /
translated: and

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas 'du byed rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar bgyid pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas 'du byed rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar bgyid pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa lags /
translated: and having generated the mind of awakening, they experience many kinds of conditioning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing sbyin pa sna tshogs yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bzod pa bsgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing sbyin pa sna tshogs yongs su gtong ba dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / bzod pa bsgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab sgom pa dang /
translated: They practice the bodhisattva activities, and while practicing the bodhisattva activities, they give various gifts, they guard ethical discipline, they cultivate patience, they undertake perseverance, they become absorbed in concentration, and they cultivate wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice inner emptiness, they practice outer emptiness, they practice inner and outer emptiness, they practice the emptiness of emptiness, they practice great emptiness,

original: @192b don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /🔽dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: @192b don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of compounded phenomena, the emptiness of uncompounded phenomena, the emptiness of what transcends limits, the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless,🔽the emptiness of nonrepudiation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of nonapprehension,

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of the absence of things, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence. They are the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags  bden pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags  bden pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon @193a *//
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon @193a *//
translated: the nine serial absorptions, and the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation.

original: par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
translated: practicing the meditative stabilizations, practicing the dhāraṇī gateways, practicing the ten tathāgata powers, practicing the four fearlessnesses, practicing the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa lags /
translated: practicing the great love, practicing the great compassion, and practicing the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / gang de skad du gal te 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang de skad du gal te 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad na /
translated: “Subhūti, as for what you have said, namely, ‘if all conditioned things are just names and signs,

original: 'o na gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod ces zer ba ni /
translated: then for whose sake do the bodhisattva great beings practice the bodhisattva practice?’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad de /🔽ming yang ming gis stong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar 'dus byas thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad de / ming yang ming gis stong /
translated: Subhūti, all conditioned things are just names and signs.🔽A name is empty of a name.

original: mtshan ma'ang mtshan mas stong pas na /
analyzed: mtshan ma'ang mtshan mas stong pas na /
translated: A sign is empty of a sign.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattva great beings practice the conduct of a bodhisattva and attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, they turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas sems can rnams theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste /
translated: Having turned the wheel of the Dharma, they liberate beings through the three vehicles.

original: ming dang mtshan ma de la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma de la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi dmigs so //
translated: In those names and signs, arising, ceasing, staying, and changing from a state of rest are not apprehended.

original: gsol @193b pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol @193b pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces gsung ngam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces gsung ngam /
translated: do you say ‘knowledge of all aspects,’ ‘knowledge of all aspects’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid cas smra'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid cas smra'o //
translated: “Subhūti, I say that the knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of all aspects.🔽” Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad shes pa nyid du gsungs pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thams cad shes pa nyid du gsungs pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs na /
translated: the Tathāgata has taught the knowledge of all things, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de gsum la khyad par ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de gsum la khyad par ni /
translated: Blessed One,🔽what is the difference

original: ci zhig mchis /🔽bye brag ni /
analyzed: ci zhig mchis / bye brag ni /
translated: between these three knowledges?

original: ci zhig mchis /🔽rnam pa ni /
analyzed: ci zhig mchis / rnam pa ni /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: ci zhig mchis /
translated: What are the aspects?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Subhūti, the knowledge of all things

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o; ;lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o; ;lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni /
translated: is for the hearers and solitary buddhas. The knowledge of the aspects of the path

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bya'o //
translated: is for the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bya'o //
translated: is to be known as the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci'i slad du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ci'i slad du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la ni /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽why is it that the knowledge of all things

original: thams cad shes pa nyid ces bgyi /🔽ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid ces bgyi / ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni /
translated: is said to be the knowledge of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?🔽Why is it that the knowledge of the aspects of the path

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bgyi /🔽ci'i slad du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la ni /🔽rnam pa thams cad @194a *//
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bgyi / ci'i slad du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la ni / rnam pa thams cad @194a *//
translated: is said to be the knowledge of the bodhisattva great beings?🔽Why is it that the knowledge of all aspects

original: mkhyen pa nyid ces bgyi /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid ces bgyi /
translated: is said to be the knowledge of the perfectly enlightened buddhas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / ji tsam phyi dang nang gi chos ji snyed pa tsam ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / ji tsam phyi dang nang gi chos ji snyed pa tsam ni /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: thams cad nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes te /🔽lam thams cad du ni /
analyzed: thams cad nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes te / lam thams cad du ni /
translated: “Subhūti, the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas know all the outer and inner phenomena

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

analyzed: 'di ni / dgra bcom pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab tu 'byed pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa med mod kyi /
translated: the unconditioned is not differentiated.

original: 'on kyang tshig chad mar byas shing brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig chad mar byas shing brjod de /
translated: However, it is expressed in words,

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: but ultimately

original: rab tu dbye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rab tu dbye bar mi nus so //
translated: it cannot be differentiated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la tshig gi lam gyi gdags pa med de /
analyzed: de la tshig gi lam gyi gdags pa med de /
translated: Because there is no designation of a path of words there.

original: 'on kyang gang dang gang gis mtha' ched pa de dang de dag la phyi ma'i mtha' gdags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang dang gang gis mtha' ched pa de dang de dag la phyi ma'i mtha' gdags pa yin te /
translated: However, wherever there is a limit, there is a designation of a later limit.

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs na /
translated: Subhūti, if the previous limit of all phenomena that are empty of their own characteristics is not apprehended,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: how could the later limit be apprehended?

original: gnas med do //
analyzed: gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible.

original: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can de dag chos rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par mi shes pas /
translated: Subhūti, since sentient beings do not know that phenomena are empty of their own characteristics,

original: de dag la 'di skad @197a *//🔽du; 'di ni /🔽sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad @197a *// du; 'di ni / sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they are told,🔽‘This is called the previous limit.

original: 'di ni / phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the later limit.’

original: zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la sngon gyi mtha'am phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la sngon gyi mtha'am phyi ma'i mtha' dmigs su med do //
translated: The beginning or end of all phenomena empty of their own characteristics is not observed.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par byas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par byas te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, so you should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la spyad na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la spyad na /
translated: Having practiced all phenomena empty of their own characteristics,

original: nang ngam / phyi'i chos sam /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: nang ngam / phyi'i chos sam / 'dus byas sam /
translated: you will not become attached to any phenomena, whether internal or external,

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: whether compounded or uncompounded,

original: nyan thos kyi chos sam /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos sam / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos sam /
translated: whether the phenomena of the hearers,🔽the phenomena of the solitary buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la'ang mngon par chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or the phenomena of the buddhas.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi /
translated: “Why is it called the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pa yin te /
translated: is the attainment of the highest perfection of all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor; gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @197b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor; gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @197b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, through this perfection of wisdom, all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattva great beings, and tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas have reached the perfection of all dharmas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur bas /
translated: They have reached the perfection of perfection.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis chos thams cad kyi mchog gi tshul phyed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis chos thams cad kyi mchog gi tshul phyed de /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom reveals the mode of the supremacy of all dharmas.

original: chos de dag kun la'ang 'khor ba mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: chos de dag kun la'ang 'khor ba mi dmigs pas /
translated: And in all those dharmas, saṃsāra is not observed.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, in this perfection of wisdom is included suchness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang chud /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang chud /
translated: the limit of reality,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang chud de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang chud de /
translated: and the dharma-constituent.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is not associated with or

original: chos gang gis kyang ldan pa'am /🔽mi ldan pa'am; bstan du yod pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang gis kyang ldan pa'am / mi ldan pa'am; bstan du yod pa'am /
translated: disassociated from any dharma,🔽is not demonstrable,

original: bstan du med pa'am /🔽thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: bstan du med pa'am / thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: is not indemonstrable,🔽is not impeded,

original: thogs pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: and is not unimpeded.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: In this way, the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs med pa; bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa; bstan du med pa /
translated: is formless, invisible,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: unobstructed,

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: and of one mark—that is, no mark.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad kyi spobs pa thams cad dang / snang ba thams cad skyas pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spobs pa thams cad dang / snang ba thams cad skyas pa ste /
translated: is the source of all the eloquence and all the appearances of all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams sam /
analyzed: bdud dam bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams sam /
translated: cannot be cut off or taken away by Māra or the gods of Māra’s class,

original: gang zag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa @198a *//
analyzed: gang zag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa @198a *//
translated: or by the followers of the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas,

original: nas mu stegs can gzhan dang sdig pa'i grogs po rnams kyis mi chod mi 'phrogs pa ste /
analyzed: nas mu stegs can gzhan dang sdig pa'i grogs po rnams kyis mi chod mi 'phrogs pa ste /
translated: or by other tīrthikas and evil companions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad par mi nus so //
translated: They are unable to practice this perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de dag thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la de dag thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because in this perfection of wisdom all these dharmas are not apprehended, because of the emptiness of own-marks.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhuti, should the Bodhisattva, the great being, course in this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyod pas mi rtag pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyod pas mi rtag pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in this deep perfection of wisdom, should course in the meaning of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal gyi don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the meaning of ill,

original: bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //🔽sdug bsngal shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //🔽kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o // sdug bsngal shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o // kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the meaning of not-self,🔽in the meaning of the knowledge of ill,🔽in the meaning of the knowledge of the origin of ill,

original: 'gog pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the meaning of the knowledge of the stopping of ill,

original: lam shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in the meaning of the knowledge of the path,🔽in the meaning of the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements,🔽in the meaning of the knowledge of the non-arising of defilements.

original: zad pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in the meaning of the knowledge of extinction.

original: mi skye ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in the meaning of the knowledge of non-arising.

original: chos shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in the meaning of the knowledge of phenomena.

original: rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //🔽kun rdzob shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o // kun rdzob shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in the meaning of the knowledge of subsequent attainment.🔽One should practice in the meaning of conventional knowledge.

original: yongs su rtogs pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in the meaning of the knowledge of thorough understanding.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice in the meaning of knowledge that is just as the words [indicate].

original: rab @198b 'byor /
analyzed: rab @198b 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyad par bya'o //
translated: in that way, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should practice in the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la don dang don ma lags pa mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la don dang don ma lags pa mi dmigs na /
translated: if in this profound perfection of wisdom, meaning and non-meaning are not apprehended,

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don la spyad par bgyi /
translated: then how should bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice in the meaning of this profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di la spyod pas 'di ltar spyad par bya ste /🔽'dod chags bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di la spyod pas 'di ltar spyad par bya ste / 'dod chags bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: “Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing this profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom should practice like this:

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽zhes sdang bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // zhes sdang bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Attachment is for my benefit’ or ‘is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: ‘Aversion is for my benefit’ or ‘is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: gti mug bdag gi don ce'am; don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: gti mug bdag gi don ce'am; don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Delusion is for my benefit’ or ‘is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽log par lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // log par lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘Attachment, aversion, and delusion are for my benefit’ or ‘are not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽bdag tu lta ba bdag gi don ce 'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // bdag tu lta ba bdag gi don ce 'am /
translated: ‘Wrong view is for my benefit’ or ‘is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: ‘The view of a self is for my benefit’ or ‘is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: sems can du lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: sems can du lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: ‘The view of a being is for my benefit’ or ‘is not for my benefit’ should not be practiced.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o; ;srog tu lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o; ;srog tu lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage in what is not the meaning.🔽🔽The view of life is for one's own purpose.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽gso bar lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // gso bar lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of life force as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽skyes bur lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // skyes bur lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of nourishment as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: @199a *// don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽gang zag tu lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: @199a *// don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // gang zag tu lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of a person as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽shed can du lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // shed can du lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of an individual as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽Do not engage with the view of a human being as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽shed bdag tu lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // shed bdag tu lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of a human as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽byed pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // byed pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of a sentient being as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽byed du 'jug pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // byed du 'jug pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of an agent as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not engage with the view of an instigator as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: tshor ba bor lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: tshor ba bor lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: Do not engage with the view of a feeler as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽tshor du 'jug pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // tshor du 'jug pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: One should not engage with the view of the one who experiences as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who perceives as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽slong ba por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // slong ba por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: One should not engage with the view of the one who is aroused as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who arouses as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who knows as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽kun nas slong ba por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // kun nas slong ba por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: One should not engage with the view of the one who sees as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who hears as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who smells as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who tastes as either meaningful or meaningless.🔽One should not engage with the view of the one who touches as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽shes pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // shes pa por lta ba bdag gi don ce'am /
translated: One should not engage with the view of the one who thinks as either meaningful or meaningless.

original: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

original: gang la'ang don du mi byed /

analyzed: nam mkha'i khams bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

translated: “The transcendent perfection of meditative concentration is not for my benefit” is not something to be cultivated.🔽“The transcendent perfection of wisdom is for my benefit” is not something to be cultivated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽nang stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // nang stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: nang stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // phyi stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “Outer emptiness is not for my benefit” is not something to be cultivated.

analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o; ;phyi nang stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice thinking, ‘The emptiness of external and internal phenomena is for my benefit.’ One should not practice thinking, ‘The emptiness of external and internal phenomena is not for my benefit.’

analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // chen po stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice thinking, ‘The emptiness of emptiness is not for my benefit.’🔽One should not practice thinking, ‘The emptiness of great extent is for my benefit.’

analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // 'dus byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice thinking, ‘The emptiness of ultimate reality is not for my benefit.’🔽One should not practice thinking, ‘The emptiness of conditioned phenomena is for my benefit.’

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “The emptiness of the unconditioned should not be practiced, thinking ‘it is my benefit,’

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o // mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

translated: “The emptiness of what is beginningless and endless should not be practiced, thinking ‘it is my benefit,’🔽nor should it be practiced, thinking ‘it is not my benefit.’

analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “The emptiness of nonrepudiation should not be practiced, thinking ‘it is my benefit,’🔽nor should it be practiced, thinking ‘it is not my benefit.’

analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // chos thams cad stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'i //

analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice thinking, “The emptiness of nonapprehension is my goal.”

analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

translated: “The legs of manifest ability should not be practiced as having a meaning for oneself.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “The noble eightfold path is not for my benefit” is not something to be practiced.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “The truths are for my benefit” is not something to be practiced.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // bsam gtan rnams bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

translated: “The concentrations are not for my benefit” is not how you should train.🔽“The immeasurables are for my benefit” is not how you should train.

analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “The eight deliverances are not for my benefit” is not how you should train.

analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “The nine serial steps of meditative absorption are for my benefit” is not how you should train.

analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not practice, thinking, ‘The nine serial steps of meditative absorption are not for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘The gateways to liberation—namely, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness—are for my benefit.’

translated: “One should not practice, thinking, ‘The gateways to liberation—namely, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness—are not for my benefit.’

analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // ting nge 'dzin rnams bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not practice, thinking, ‘The four kinds of unhindered cognition are not for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘Great loving kindness is for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘Great loving kindness is not for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘Great compassion is for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘Great compassion is not for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘The eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are for my benefit.’

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not practice, thinking, ‘The eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are not for my benefit.’

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams bdag gi don ces spyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams bdag gi don ces spyod par mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not practice, thinking, ‘The thirty-two major marks of a great being are for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘The thirty-two major marks of a great being are not for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘The eighty minor marks are for my benefit.’🔽“One should not practice, thinking, ‘The eighty minor marks are not for my benefit.’

analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘The dhāraṇī gateways are not for my benefit.’🔽You should not practice thinking, ‘The ten powers of the tathāgatas are for my benefit.’

translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘The ten powers of the tathāgatas are not for my benefit.’🔽You should not practice thinking, ‘The four fearlessnesses are for my benefit.’

translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘The four detailed and thorough knowledges are not for my benefit.’🔽You should not practice thinking, ‘Great love is for my benefit.’🔽You should not practice thinking, ‘Great love is not for my benefit.’

original: snying rje chen po bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not practice thinking, ‘Great compassion is for my benefit.’

translated: One should not practice thinking, “The eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha are not for my benefit.”🔽One should not practice thinking, “The fruit of entering the stream is for my benefit.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

translated: One should not practice thinking, “The fruit of entering the stream is not for my benefit.”🔽One should not practice thinking, “The fruit of being tied to one more rebirth is for my benefit.”

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “Arhatship is my benefit” is not something to be practiced.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //🔽rang byang chub bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o // rang byang chub bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: “Arhatship is not my benefit” is not something to be practiced.🔽“A pratyekabuddha’s awakening is my benefit” is not something to be practiced.

analyzed: rang byang chub bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bdag gi don ces spyad par mi bya'o //

translated: “The knowledge with regard to the aspects of the path is not my benefit” is not something to be practiced.🔽“Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is my benefit” is not something to be practiced.

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o //

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /

translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, does not apprehend any dharma whatsoever that is to be done or not to be done.🔽Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, does not apprehend any dharma whatsoever that is to be done or not to be done.

translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, does not apprehend any dharma whatsoever that is to be done or not to be done.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “The unconditioned

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de de bzhin te /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: mi dmigs pa na thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lo ma phun sum tshogs par gyur; me tog phun sum tshogs par gyur /
